image.altText: A photo showing pants and land with an ocean view with building in background.

props.synopsis: A case of leprosy has been detected in the Northern Territory, prompting outcry over remote living conditions for Indigenous Australians.

title.children: Should be ashamed': NT leprosy case highlights health inequalities, experts say

image.altText: Signage on a shop front with a red house silhouette that reads Chemist Warehouse.

props.synopsis: The Australian Competition and Consumer Commission says a proposed merger between pharmacy retail giant Chemist Warehouse and Sigma Healthcare raises "competition concerns" in the country's pharmacy sector.

title.children: 'Major structural change' for country's pharmacy sector flagged by ACCC of Chemist Warehouse merger

image.altText: An older woman walks down a crowded aisle at a grocery store.

props.synopsis: A single person out of work and living in a shared house has an average of just $127 left each week for bills or incidental expenses after covering rent, transport and food, the report finds, while a single-parent household on the Parenting Payment has just $24 remaining each week.

title.children: 'Never been harder': Job seekers are barely scraping by, Anglicare Australia says in annual cost-of-living report

image.altText: A composite picture of two women and a man, all looking serious.

props.synopsis: Senators from across the political spectrum have agreed the public service is over-reliant on consultants, but they are not in perfect agreement on the way forward.

title.children: Three senators have exposed Canberra's 'vicious' consultant problem. But don't expect change overnight

image.altText: Svalbard entrance

props.synopsis: A team of scientists on the front lines of climate change are helping nature heal itself. But as wars rage around them, it's making their efforts to feed an increasingly hungry globe that much harder.

title.children: Deep inside the permafrost lies a doomsday vault holding the seeds of humanity. Only one person has taken them out

image.altText: Close up of Peter Dutton in glasses.

props.synopsis: Two years ago, few would have thought Peter Dutton would go to the next election without a 2030 climate target. So what's changed?

title.children: Captain's call or press conference slip-up? Dutton's 2030 climate target U-turn surprised even his colleagues

image.altText: A photo of a four people wearing black clothes walking out a building.

props.synopsis: The murder trial of Keith Kerinauia has heard the mother of stabbing victim Declan Laverty, who was allegedly murdered while working at a Darwin bottle shop in 2023, was aware her son carried a knife to work, and had encouraged him to do so for his own protection.

title.children: Court hears mother of man fatally stabbed at bottle shop encouraged her son to carry a knife at work for protection

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Australian stocks are trading higher on Thursday, following a rally on Wall Street after softer US inflation data. Meanwhile, Australia's unemployment rate has fallen slightly to 4 per cent in May. Follow live.

title.children: 'Labour market remains relatively tight' as unemployment rate falls, local shares pushing higher

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Positivity continues pushing the ASX higher at lunch
Unpacking the decline of the unemployment rate in May
BREAKING: Unemployment rate falls to 4.0pc in May

image.altText: Hayley Harrison jogging through a park.

props.synopsis: Heavy menstrual bleeding affects one in four women but despite the pain and disruption it causes, only half seek medical help. Doctors are trying to change that.

title.children: Hundreds of thousands of women live with abnormally heavy periods. Clinicians say they don't have to

image.altText: A couple look into a community meeting hall

props.synopsis: Communities, like those in Victoria's Port Fairy, are pushing back against seismic blasting that threatened marine life in the Otway basin and surrounding areas.

title.children: Port Fairy has seen off energy developers before. Jock Serong is part of the community - he shares what it's been like

image.altText: New NT prison

props.synopsis: The NT coroner finds Aboriginal man Mr Dooley, who died in custody in 2022, may have been experiencing the effects of cardiac arrest for up to two days before an ambulance was called to the Darwin prison.

title.children: Aboriginal man possibly suffered cardiac arrest effects for two days before hospitalisation, NT coroner finds

image.altText: A smiling woman in cold weather gear sits in front of a large ship, surrounded by snow.

props.synopsis: A survey of women who have done field work in the Arctic and Antarctic has found 79 per cent had a negative experience. The report's authors say "broad cultural and institutional changes" are needed.

title.children: Women working in polar areas 'basically half naked to go to the toilet', a report into field work conditions finds

image.altText: a design of an orange sculpture with what appears to be mangoes hanging off it

props.synopsis: On the 50th anniversary of one of Australia's worst ever natural disasters, hundreds of survivors have criticised a planned monument being built in tribute to the tragic event.

title.children: 'Mango tree': Strong criticism from cyclone survivors over $700k public art paying tribute to Cyclone Tracy disaster

image.altText: An a lone emu looks down the barrel of the camera.

props.synopsis: Ruby Buchanan was getting ready to take her dogs for a walk when she and a friend were "fully charged" by four emus outside Broken Hill. A ranger says the large flightless birds can attack around this time of year as chicks mature.

title.children: Dog walker set upon by pack of territorial emus in startling but 'very funny' confrontation

image.altText: A cream house with a small yard.  A sign in the yard says it is against heritage protections.

props.synopsis: The residents of War Workers Housing Estate in Moorooka have been fighting a temporary heritage listing that was placed over 180 homes in 2022, while council worked to make the overlay permanent.

title.children: Over $20m in value stripped from homes in Brisbane estate after 'unprecedented' heritage listing introduced

image.altText: A vape in a hand with a playground out of focus in the background

props.synopsis: Minister for Health and Aged Care Mark Butler says one in six high school students, along with one in four 18–24-year-olds, is vaping. RMIT ABC Fact Check takes a look at the research.

title.children: We fact checked Mark Butler on vaping rates among young people. Here's what we found

image.altText: Former NRL player Jarryd Hayne looking unhappy in a street

props.synopsis: Jarryd Hayne walked out of prison yesterday after his sexual assault convictions were quashed on appeal. The Director of Public Prosecutions will decide whether he will be tried for a fourth time.

title.children: Appeal judges don't have a say on 'very rare' fourth trial for Jarryd Hayne, but hinted at their thoughts

image.altText: A large yellow spider with black and red markings sits in a web

props.synopsis: Swarms of giant spiders invading one of the world's largest cities sounds like the stuff of horror movies — the reality is less scary.

title.children: 'Giant' spiders 'check all the boxes for public hysteria', but experts say there's more to Joro spiders

image.altText: University

props.synopsis: The plan to limit how many international students can study in Australia could damage the credit rating of the nation's top universities, and halt their climb of the global ranking ladder, credit rating agency S&P Global warns.

title.children: International student caps could harm global rankings of Australia's top unis, credit rating S&P agency warns

image.altText: A young woman wearing a blue nurse's uniform smiles while holding up a babygrow

props.synopsis: British nurse Lucy Letby, who was jailed last year for murdering seven babies and trying to kill six others, is on trial accused of the attempted murder of another baby in her care.

title.children: British serial killer Lucy Letby on trial accused of murdering baby girl

image.altText: An illustration of a winged creature that lived during the time of the dinosaurs

props.synopsis: Fossilised remains thought to be 100 million years old have been identified as a new species of pterosaur, a powerful flying predator with a wingspan of up to 12 metres.

title.children: Outback fossil find confirms giant 'demonic pelicans' filled Australia's skies 100 million years ago

image.altText: Sonar image of a shipwreck at the bottom of the sea.

props.synopsis: Shipwreck hunters have found the last expedition ship of Sir Ernest Shackleton off Canada's coast, and they say the vessel is "largely intact".

title.children: Explorer Ernest Shackleton's ship found at bottom of Atlantic

image.altText: Hockeyroos players celebrate a goal against Great Britain.

props.synopsis: With the Olympics looming, the Hockeyroos and Kookaburras both score impressive wins over Great Britain to wrap up their FIH Pro League seasons in style.

title.children: Hockeyroos, Kookaburras warm up for Paris Olympics by beating Great Britain

image.altText: Lia Thomas after finishing a race at the 2022 NCAA Championships.

props.synopsis: Lia Thomas loses her case against World Aquatics at the Court of Arbitration for Sport, with the decision preventing the American from having any chance of competing at the Paris Olympics.

title.children: Transgender swimmer Lia Thomas loses CAS case to overturn World Aquatics ban

image.altText: Drone shot of housing estate

props.synopsis: Labor's budget was all about cost of living but the LNP's reply is focused on housing, with David Crisafulli looking to boost home ownership and rental stock.

title.children: Waiving stamp duty for first home buyers among housing policies unveiled by Queensland opposition

image.altText: A child sits in front of a birthday cake outside surrounded by guests

props.synopsis: Two suburban housewives, played by Anne Hathaway and Jessica Chastain, are the best of friends. Until tragedy strikes, and everything on their idyllic street turns dark and twisted.

title.children: Anne Hathaway becomes obsessed with her neighbours in this glossy psychological thriller

image.altText: A wide elevated image of a city centre intersection in Cairns

props.synopsis: Cairns needs tens of millions of dollars to shore up its security of drinking water, but advocates say the city also needs to look at ways to reduce the amount of water being used.

title.children: Drinking water security and efficiency in spotlight in Cairns, despite high rainfall, as supply shortfall looms

image.altText: People walk amongst rubble in Gaza.

props.synopsis: As Israeli special forces executed a daring daytime raid to release four hostages of Hamas, Abdullah watched on before his building was destroyed by an air strike.

title.children: 'Just like you see in American movies': Witness describes Israeli raid to rescue Hamas hostages

image.altText: young people gather along a barrier and film musicians with their iphones

props.synopsis: The Ord Valley Muster showcases the East Kimberley's Indigenous culture, pastoral heritage and spectacular landscape, but a ticket sale dive at last month's event has put the festival on shaky financial ground.

title.children: Rock legends say government should step in to save major WA cultural festival

image.altText: Ariarne Titmus holds up her hand

props.synopsis: Ariarne Titmus breaks the 200m freestyle world record by almost a second to pip world champion Mollie O'Callaghan.

title.children: Ariarne Titmus smashes 200m world record in stunning head-to-head with Mollie O'Callaghan

image.altText: Ariarne Titmus leans into Mollie O'Callaghan

props.synopsis: Ariarne Titmus and Mollie O'Callaghan are the two fastest 200m swimmers of all time. And they share the same pool week-in, week-out in training.

title.children: Australia's two swimming stars push each other to greater heights, whether they like it or not
